newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Fortis AG capital increase 95.77 pct subscribed.
newsitem.headline: Fortis AG capital increase 95.77 pct subscribed.

text.p: Belgian insurance group Fortis AG said its capital increase which closed on February 26 was 95.77 percent subscribed.
In total, 3,071,627 new shares and associated tax benefit "VVPR" strips were subscribed, which will be registered on the Brussels and Antwerp bourse from March 12, the company said in a statement.

The 1,628,556 non-exercised pre-emption rights will be offered for sale on the Brussels bourse from March 7. One new share will be issued at 5,040 francs for every twelve rights. After March 17 the rights will have no value, Fortis said.
If all rights are subscribed, a further 135,713 new Fortis AG shares will be created.
Fortis AG is the Belgian parent of Belgian-Dutch banking and insurance group Fortis. The Dutch partner is Fortis AMEV.
